results.title: Battle of Britain
results.creator_credit: Guy Hamilton, Harry Saltzman, S Benjamin Fisz Productions and United Artists Corporation
results.brief_description: This film recreates the greatest air battle in history, when the outnumbered British Royal Airforce battled and fought off the powerful German Luftwaffe at the beginning of World War II. For this film more than 100 vintage aircraft were assembled to re-enact the historic battle in the skies over England. Stars Michael Caine, Trevor Howard, Curt Jurgens, Kenneth More, Ralph Richardson.

results.title: Gamlet = Hamlet
results.brief_description:
In this Russian version of Shakespeare’s play the Prince of Denmark is no vacillating dreamer but, like everything else in the film, muscular and volatile. A radical adaptation of Shakespeare, this version of Hamlet upset the purists with its bold interpretation of the play. Hamlet delivers one of theatre’s most famous soliloquies - ‘To be or not to be’ - with his back to the camera. The images, enriched by the dramatic Shostakovitch music, are bold, sweeping and powerful. Filmed in location in Estonia, the majestic castle is symbolic of Hamlet’s torture, trapped in the quagmire of his quest to avenge his father’s death. In Russian with English subtitles. Also available in 16mm.

Credits: Director, writer, Grigorii Kozintsev ; photography, Jonas Gritsyus ; music, Dmitrii Shostakovitch ; editing, Ye Makhankova.
Cast: Anastasia Vertinskay, Innokenty Smoktunovsky, Mikhail Nazvanov, Elza Radzina, Yuri Tolubeyev, Vadim Medvedev.

results.title: Sorok pervyy = The Forty first
results.brief_description:
Set during the civil war in Turkestan, ‘The Forty First’ is a remake of the story of romance with a Red woman commander and her captive White officer. In a remote region of Russia, skirmishes are fought between two armies in conflict. The conditions are trying - in the sand dunes of eastern Russia there are few resources for the embattled soldiers. A courageous sharpshooter, the commander is escorting her prisoner to his new confines when the two are marooned. Inevitably romance erupts between the enemies who are drawn into a struggle involving personal feelings and class identification. Remembering her duty, the commander makes a tragic decision, killing her lover in order to save him from capture, when the pair are rescued by Czarists. A typically patriotic Soviet drama from the 1950s that delves into an interesting wartime moral dilemma.

Credits: Director, Grigorii Chukhrai ; writer, Grigorii Koltunov ; photography, Sergei Urusevskii ; music, Nikolai Kriukov.
Cast: Izolda Izvitskaya, Oleg Strizhenov, Nikolai Kryuchkov, Nikolai Dupak, Georgiy Shapovalov.

results.title: Ballada o soldate = Ballad of a soldier
results.brief_description:
A naive and unworldly Soviet soldier commits a reluctant act of bravery during World War II. In return he is awarded four days of coveted leave, returning to his mother in order to thatch her roof. En route, the generous teenager uses much of his precious time helping strangers in need. Encountering chaos and destitution, he witnesses the stoicism of the Russian people as they face misery, hunger and displacement. On the train home he meets a woman with whom he falls in love but his fate is sealed — he barely makes it home to his mother, in time to return to the Front and most assuredly his death. A simple and sentimental drama, which documents the Russian wartime experience and winner of several international awards, ‘Ballad of a Soldier’ was the first Russian film to receive acclaim in America during the Cold War period.

Credits: Director, Grigori Chukhrai ; writer, Valentin Yoshov, Grigori Chukrai ; photography, Vladimir Nikolayev, Era Saveleva ; music, Mikhail Ziv ; editing, M. Timofeieva.
Cast: Vladimir Ivashov, Zhanna Prokhorenko, Antonina Maksimova, Nikolai Kryuchkov, Yevgeny Urbansky, Valentina Telegina.

results.title: King Solomon's mines
results.creator_credit: Andrew Marton, Compton Bennett, Sam Zimbalist, Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer and United Artists Corporation
results.brief_description: Perhaps no film in history has ever captured the languid and treacherous beauty of the jungle as has this shot on location spectacular based on H. Rider Haggard’s colossal tale. Stewart Granger, Deborah Kerr and Richard Carlson are thoroughly convincing as three adventurers on a perilous quest in the wilds of darkest Africa. At her beguiling best, Deborah Kerr plays a prim English lady whose husband has vanished into the jungle while searching for the legendary mines of King Solomon. Stewart Granger’s portrayal of Allan Quartermain, “white hunter” and reluctant leader of the danger fraught expedition, is one of the finest roles of his swashbuckling career. “King Solomon’s Mines” offers a colourful palette of action, danger, suspense, drama and romance. Particularly exciting are the extraordinary animal stampedes captured by Robert Sutees’ Oscar winning cinematography.

results.title: Letyat zhuravli = The Cranes are flying
results.brief_description:
An anti-war love story set during the early years of World War II, ‘The Cranes Are Flying’ is a romantic drama about love, loss and recovery from catastrophe. When a young hospital worker hears that her fiance has been killed in the war, she is traumatised and refuses to believe it. Raped by a distant cousin during an air raid, she eventually marries him, despite feeling no love, and continues to mourn for her dead lover. A subsequent turn of events re-establishes her faith in life and her confidence returns. Winner of Best Film at the Cannes Film Festival, 1958

Credits: Producer, director, Mikhail Kalatozov ; writer, Victor Rosov ; photography, Sergei Urusevski ; music, M. Vainberg ; editing, Mariya Timofeyeva.
Cast: Tatiana Samoilova, Alexei Batalov, Vasily Merkuryev, Alexander Shvorin, Svetlana Kharitonova, Konstantin Nikitin.

results.title: Murder most foul
results.creator_credit: George Pollock, Ben Arbeid and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Based upon the novel “Mrs. McGinty’s Dead” by Agatha Christie. Juror Miss Marple refuses to return a guilty verdict and initiates her own murder investigation backstage at a third-rate repertory company. A village baffler brimming with red herrings and tangled motives. Starring Margaret Rutherford and Ron Moody.

results.title: 'Murder ahoy'
results.creator_credit: George Pollock, Lawrence P. Bachmann and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: A sea-going whodunit where the intrepid Miss Marple finds herself investigating events on the HMS Battledore, a navy training ship designed to give young hoodlums a chance at new lives. Miss Marple discovers some-one is training the delinquents to be good thieves instead of good citizens and is willing to kill to keep the fact quiet! Murder Ahoy features a rogues gallery of suspects and ingenious means of despatching victims including strychnine-laced snuff, a poisoned mousetrap and a noose from a yard-arm. Starring Margaret Rutherford, Lionel Jeffries and Stringer Davis.

results.title: La Rupture = The Breakup
results.creator_credit: Claude Chabrol, Cinevog Films, Euro International and Les Films de la Boetie
results.brief_description:
A wife and mother, Helene, battles to defend herself and her child against an attack by her husband Charles while he is under the influence of LSD. With his son in hospital her father-in-law moves to gain custody of the child by employing the needy Paul to spy on Helene in order to find cause. This is the fourth of Chabrol’s series of thrillers set in bourgeois households, usually involving a triangle, that began with ‘Les Biches’ (1968). It also involves a further variant on the redemption-through-the-assumption-of-guilt theme recurring in Chabrol’s films, which he found, as a critic, recurring in Hitchcock’s work. Also available on VHS.

Credits: Director, [script], Claude Chabrol ; photography, Jean Rabier ; music, Pierre Jansen ; editor, Jacques Gaillard ; sound, Guy Chichignoud.
Cast: Stephane Audran, Jean-Pierre Cassel, Michel Bouquet, Annie Cordy, Jean-Claude Drouot, Michel Duchaussoy.

Note: Based on the novel by Charlotte Armstrong “Le jour des parques”.

results.title: Smultronstallet = Wild strawberries
results.creator_credit: Ingmar Bergman, Allan Ekelund and Svensk Filmindustri
results.brief_description:
An aged professor - introverted and emotionally cold - makes a journey to collect a university award and en route relives his past through recollection, dreams and imagination. Borg emerges purged, if not wholly changed from this confrontation with self. The theme of the film, incarnated in the successive generations of the Borgs, is death-in-life, emotional-spiritual atrophy. It has been compared with King Lear and Strindberg’s Dream Play and in structure with a Bach fugue. Wild strawberries are a Swedish symbol for the emergence of spring, the rebirth of life. Also available on 16mm and VHS.

Credits: [Producer, Allan Ekelund] ; director, writer, Ingmar Bergman ; photography, Gunnar Fischer ; music, Erik Nordgren.
Cast: Victor Sjostrom, Ingrid Thulin, Bibi Andersson, Gunnar Bjornstrand.
